intro: Saurauia vallium, commonly known as the alpine saurauia, is a shrub native to the mountainous regions of Europe. It belongs to the Ericaceae family, which includes heathers and other ericaceous plants. The plant is characterized by its small, elliptical leaves that are typically covered in a dense layer of fine hairs. It produces clusters of small, bell-shaped white or pink flowers in the spring, followed by dark blue berries. Saurauia vallium thrives in cool, moist environments and is often found in alpine and subalpine habitats.
